channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the partial $ \mathscr L $-$ \Pi $-property of subgroups of finite groups
item.description: arXiv:2408.06348v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $ H $ be a subgroup of a finite group $ G $. We say that $ H $ satisfies the partial $ \mathscr L $-$ \Pi $-property in $ G $ if $ H\unlhd G $, or if $ | G / K : \mathrm{N} _{G / K} (HK/K)| $ is a $ \pi (HK/K) $-number for any $ G $-chief factor of type $ H^{G}/K $ with $ H_{G}\leq K $. In this paper, we investigate the structure of finite groups under the assumption that some subgroups of prime power order satisfy the partial $ \mathscr L $-$ \Pi $-property.
item.dc:creator: Zhengtian Qiu, Adolfo Ballester-Bolinches

item.title: Boundary representations of hyperbolic groups: the log-Sobolev case
item.description: arXiv:2408.06446v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study boundary representations of hyperbolic groups $\Gamma$ on the (compactly embedded) function space $W^{\log,2}(\partial\Gamma)\subset L^2(\partial\Gamma)$, the domain of the logarithmic Laplacian on $\partial\Gamma$. We show that they are not uniformly bounded, and establish their exact growth (up a multiplicative constant): they grow with the square root of the length of $g\in\Gamma$. We also obtain $L^p$--analogue of this result. Our main tool is a logarithmic Sobolev inequality on bounded Ahlfors--David regular metric measure spaces.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Boucher, J\'an \v{S}pakula

item.title: Classification of $\lambda$-homomorphic braces on $\mathbb{Z}^2$
item.description: arXiv:2408.06589v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: If $A=(A,\oplus,\odot)$ is a $\lambda$-homomorphic brace with $(A,\oplus)=\mathbb{Z}^2$, then the operations in this brace are given by formulas \begin{align*}\begin{pmatrix}a_1\\a_2\end{pmatrix}\oplus\begin{pmatrix}b_1\\b_2\end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix}a_1+b_1\\a_2+b_2\end{pmatrix},&&\begin{pmatrix}a_1\\a_2\end{pmatrix}\odot\begin{pmatrix}b_1\\b_2\end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix}a_1\\a_2\end{pmatrix}+\varphi^{a_1}\psi^{a_2}\begin{pmatrix}b_1\\b_2\end{pmatrix}, \end{align*} where $\varphi,\psi\in{\rm GL}_2(\mathbb{Z})$ are cpecific matrices which depend on $A$. Not every pair $(\varphi,\psi)$ lead to a brace. In the present paper we find all possible pairs $(\varphi,\psi)$ of matrices from ${\rm GL}_2(\mathbb{Z})$ which lead to $\lambda$-homomorphic braces with $(A,\oplus)=\mathbb{Z}^2$. The obtained result gives the full classification of $\lambda$-homomorphic braces on $\mathbb{Z}^2$ which was started by Bardakov, Neshchadim and Yadav in [J. Pure App. Algebra, V. 226, N. 6, 2022, 106961].
item.dc:creator: T. Nasybullov, I. Novikov

item.title: $H_3$-graded groups
item.description: arXiv:2408.06745v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Using the well-known realisation of the root system $ H_3 $ as a folding of $ D_6 $, one can construct examples of $ H_3 $-graded groups from Chevalley groups of type $ D_6 $. Such Chevalley groups are defined over a commutative ring $ R $, and the root groups of the resulting $ H_3 $-grading are coordinatised by $ R \times R $. We show that every $ H_3 $-graded group arises as the folding of a $ D_6 $-graded group, or in other words, that it is coordinatised by $ R \times R $ for some commutative ring $ R $.
item.dc:creator: Lennart Berg, Torben Wiedemann

item.title: The complex of cuts in a Stone space
item.description: arXiv:2408.06994v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Stone's representation theorem asserts a duality between Boolean algebras on the one hand and Stone space, which are compact, Hausdorff, and totally disconnected, on the other. This duality implies a natural isomorphism between the homeomorphism group of the space and the automorphism group of the algebra. We introduce a complex of cuts on which these groups act, and prove that when the algebra is countable and the space has at least five points, that these groups are the full automorphism group of the complex.
item.dc:creator: Beth Branman, Rylee Alanza Lyman

item.title: Geometry of Selberg's bisectors in the symmetric space $SL(n,\mathbb{R})/SO(n,\mathbb{R})$
item.description: arXiv:2302.00643v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We discussed some properties of a family of symmetric spaces, namely $\mathcal{P}(n):=SL(n,\mathbb{R})/SO(n,\mathbb{R})$, where we replace the Riemannian metric on $\mathcal{P}(n)$ with a premetric suggested by Selberg. These properties are generalizations of properties on the hyperbolic spaces $\mathbf{H}^n$ related to Poincar\'e's fundamental polyhedron theorem.
item.dc:creator: Yukun Du

item.title: Monodromy of stratified braid groups, II
item.description: arXiv:2403.04496v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The space of monic squarefree polynomials has a stratification according to the multiplicities of the critical points, called the equicritical stratification. Tracking the positions of roots and critical points, there is a map from the fundamental group of a stratum into a braid group. We give a complete determination of this map. It turns out to be characterized by the geometry of the translation surface structure on $\mathbb{CP}^1$ induced by the logarithmic derivative $df/f$ of a polynomial in the stratum.
item.dc:creator: Nick Salter

item.title: Prosoluble subgroups of the profinite completion of the fundamental group of compact 3-manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2408.04152v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We give a description of finitely generated prosoluble subgroups of the profinite completion of $3$-manifold groups and virtually compact special groups.
item.dc:creator: Lucas C. Lopes, Pavel A. Zalesskii
